title: 105_s1794
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Gulf War Veterans' Iraqi Claims Protection Act of 1998". Adjudication of claims is addressed in the Act. The United States Commission is authorized to receive and determine claims by U.S. nationals against Iraq, applying applicable law and principles of justice. Priority is given to non-commercial claims related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait or the attack on the USS Stark before other claims are decided. The United States Commission handles claims by U.S. nationals against Iraq, prioritizing non-commercial claims related to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait or the 1987 attack on the USS Stark. The International Claims Settlement Act applies to claims under this Act. SEC. 3. CLAIMS FUNDS. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to establish the Iraq Claims Fund for payment of claims. Proceeds from Iraqi asset liquidation will be allocated by the President between the Iraq Claims Fund and other accounts for payment of claims, subject to limitations. The Iraq Claims Fund is established for payment of claims, with limits set based on certified claims of the United States Government determined to be valid by the Secretary of State. SEC. 4. AUTHORITY TO VEST IRAQI ASSETS.

The President can liquidate Iraqi assets in the US to satisfy claims under section 2(a) and US Government claims not under UN jurisdiction.

SEC. 5. REIMBURSEMENT FOR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

1.5% of funds in the Iraq Claims Fund will be deducted to reimburse the US Government for administering the Act.

SEC. 6. PAYMENTS. The United States Commission certifies awards under section 2, and the Secretary of the Treasury makes payments from the Iraq Claims Fund in order of priority. This includes a $10,000 payment or the principal amount of the award, additional payments for claims with priority, and ratable payments towards unpaid balances of awards. After payments are made from the Iraq Claims Fund, any remaining funds will be transferred to the Treasury of the United States. Payment of awards under this Act does not extinguish unsatisfied claims against the Government of Iraq. SEC. 7. AUTHORITY TO TRANSFER RECORDS. The head of any Executive agency may transfer records to the United States Commission for adjudication. SEC. 8. STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS; DISPOSITION OF UNUSED FUNDS. The statute of limitations for certified awards under this Act is one year after the publication date of the required notice. The Secretary of the Treasury must publish a notice in the Federal Register after 9 years, detailing the statute of limitations and identifying unpaid claims. Unused funds will be disposed of after a 2-year period. At the end of a 2-year period, the Secretary of the Treasury will dispose of any unused funds from the Iraq Claims Fund by depositing them as miscellaneous receipts in the Treasury of the United States. Unused funds are the remaining balance in the Iraq Claims Fund. SEC. 9. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms used in the Act, including "Executive agency," "Government of Iraq," "United Nations Commission," and "United States Commission."
